page.title: 13Religion in Maesbrook
page.content: Another plaque reads:"Hector Forbes Maclean,sub-lieutenant of the Royal Navy.He was killed in action on 18 August 1919 aged 18. Recently the church has organised a coffee evening on 7 May which raised over Â£220. Some outstanding objects of the church are as follows : Nineteen stained glass windows. A large "cedar of Lebanon" in the grounds. Also in the grounds is an old gas lamp,made by R.H.Masons, of Oswestry. The church also harbours some interesting graves ranging from 1915-1985.These include the Wharton family grave which is occupied by three people.There lie Edward, Elizabeth,his wife and another relation,Ralph Charles Griffiths.
